page.title: 07PICKFORD BUILDERS
page.content: Fred Pickford came to Great Easton in 1914.He lived at the Bell with his wife Eliza Alice.They had a few cows, sheep and chickens.Fred had 5 sons and 2 daughters called Jack,Frank,Tony, Bert,David,Ruth and Mary.Fred started "Fred Pickford Builder",in 1914. He did not have many workers at first but as more people moved into the Village he had to employ more workers.When his sons had left school they started working for him.They worked from 5.00am-6.00pm and got 50p a week which was considered a lot in those days. Later when Fred's three sons Frank, Bert and Tony owned the company they called it "Pickford and Sons".They did nearly the same work as Fred making tools and carts and restoring old houses.Bert's son and nephews own it now and it's called "Pickford Builders".
